intro: Rhetinantha flavoviridis, commonly known as the yellow-green fern, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves that are typically yellow-green in color, which contribute to its common name. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is native to certain regions of Africa and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
